meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of tow
meanings.sent1: The towy blanket felt rough against my skin.
meanings.sent2: The towy rope was used to tie the branches together.
meanings.sent3: The towy fabric made the costume look like a scarecrow.
meanings.sent4: The towy field resembled a golden sea of grass.
meanings.sent5: The towy texture of the paper reminded me of straw.

meanings.sent1: The towy truck pulled the broken car to the mechanic.
meanings.sent2: The towy boat helped rescue the stranded sailors.
meanings.sent3: The towy tractor seemed eager to help move the heavy load.
meanings.sent4: The towy chain linked the two vehicles together securely.
meanings.sent5: The towy winch made it easy to move the fallen tree.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of Towyn, a town in Wales
meanings.sent1: The towy architecture of the building reflected the town's style.
meanings.sent2: The towy accents of the locals were charming to listen to.
meanings.sent3: The towy flags fluttered proudly in the town square.
meanings.sent4: The towy landscape around Towyn was breathtakingly beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The towy atmosphere of the town made me feel at home.
